newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY'S ELMU CONTINUES NOTE ISSUANCE PROGRAMME.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY'S ELMU CONTINUES NOTE ISSUANCE PROGRAMME.

text.p: Hungary's Budapest Electricity Works (Elmu Rt) has placed privately discount notes worth 500 million forints in face value with a maturity of 151 days, Hungary's financial watchdog APTF said on Wednesday.
The placement comes at investor initiative and forms part of Elmu's three billion forints note issues programme.
In the first tranche, in May, Elmu issued discount notes worth one billion forints privately with six months of maturity.
The note issues, arranged by WestLB Investment (Magyarorszag) Rt, aim at general corporate finance purposes.
Elmu distributes electricity to the Hungarian capital and its shares are traded on the over-the-counter market.
